sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews Now. Thanks for joining us on the show.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I'm Anka Ula. Let's get you up to speed with today's headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The leaders of the EU's three largest economies are in Kiev visiting sites of Russian attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The high-profile visit aims to show a united European front in supporting Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: NATO defense ministers meet in Brussels to discuss how to increase their support for Kiev after the U.S. announces a new round of aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And tipping one back to end the so-called Whiskey War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A good-natured land dispute between Canada and Denmark has ended as the two nations agree to split an area in the Arctic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: in the Arctic. The leaders of France, Germany and Italy have arrived in Kyiv after boarding a train from Poland earlier today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi, French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz are set to meet Ukraine's president ahead of NATO and EU summits.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is their first visit to the country since the war began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After arriving in Ukraine's capital, Macron stopped to give a message to the Ukrainian people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A message of European unity to the Ukrainian people, indeed, of support to talk about both the present and the future because the coming weeks as we know will be very difficult weeks european commission president ursula von der leyen also visited ukraine on saturday where she discussed the prospect of ukraine's eu membership today's visit follows an announcement from Washington that will provide an additional 1 billion euros to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Air raid sirens sounded across the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, shortly after the arrival of Olaf Scholz, Emmanuel Macron and Mario Draghi, signaling that war is very much an ongoing reality for Ukrainians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The leaders of Germany, France and Italy traveled by train to meet their Ukrainian counterpart, Volodymyr Zelensky, for a working lunch, a very symbolic meeting, a much-anticipated visit on the part of these three EU leaders who have been criticized by Ukrainian authorities in the past for what was described as their lukewarm support for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We all remember, and certainly Volodymyr Zelensky remembers very well, the time when all Germany was ready to offer Ukraine were 5,000 helmets. And more recently, Emmanuel Macron angered authorities there when he said that Russia should not be humiliated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Volodymyr Zelensky will have a chance to address these missteps or misunderstandings directly, as well as ask for what kind of help Ukraine needs right now. He will certainly ask for more military support, for more weapons, more ammunition, but also discuss the status of Ukraine's EU candidacy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We know that this meeting comes a week before EU leaders are set to meet and discuss just that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And that is a very important aspect of this war during my time in ukraine i met soldiers on the front lines who said that a future within the european union was ultimately what they were fighting for annelise borges in paris for euro news brazilian federal police have confirmed a local man has confessed to having murdered

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: the environment expert Bruno Pereira and the British journalist Dom Phillips.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Human remains buried in the place indicated by the suspect will be sent for examination in the capital, Brasilia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The first person arrested for this case, known as Pelado Mr. Amarildo, voluntarily decided to confess to the crime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He narrated in detail and pointed out the place where he buried the bodies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Pereira and Phillips had last been seen in the Vale de Javari indigenous land.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The reserve near the border with Peru is bigger than the island of Ireland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's also the scene of conflicts related to drug trafficking, timber theft and illegal mining.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The search involved the Brazilian army, the navy, the Amazonas Public Safety Office and the federal police, as well as around 100 indigenous volunteers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The UN has expressed grave concerns for the condition of civilians who remain trapped in Severodonetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Hundreds are said to be bunkered down underneath the Azot chemical plant with a reduced clean water supply, sanitation and electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A break in the shelling facilitating a humanitarian corridor never materialised, dashing hopes of an evacuation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Both sides blame each other.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainians, apparently ignoring the unilateral offer from the Russians, they claimed it was linked to a deadline to surrender.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A spokesman for the UN's Humanitarian Affairs Office said that both parties to the conflict have an obligation under international humanitarian law to protect civilians, so it's not an option.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They have to assure the people who want to leave the city they can do it safely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky used his nightly address to thank U.S. President Joe Biden for pledging another $1 billion worth of weapons aid to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Both the U.S. and Zelensky have said the battle in the east of Ukraine has reached a pivotal moment in the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Russian military has, however, claimed to have used long-range missiles to destroy a depot in the western Lviv region where ammunition for NATO-supplied weapons were stored.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, mostly elderly and disabled residents from a small town on the edge of the Donetsk region arrived in western Ukraine after having been forced to abandon their homes because of the increasingly heavy fighting in Donbas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is putting pressure on NATO. It hopes to receive more weapons and support from the alliance's members.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: NATO also wants to provide more support to Ukraine as the fighting in the Donbas enters its decisive phase.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The US Defense Secretary spoke about the prospect of an additional aid package.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: about the prospect of an additional aid package.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The United States will provide an additional $1 billion security assistant package for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And it includes guided MLRS munitions, 18 more M777 howitzers, and the tactical vehicles to tow them and 36 000 rounds of 155 millimeter ammunition the package also includes 620 million euros for two more coastal defense systems and thousands of secure radios night vision devices and thermal sites rights. In a message to the Czech parliament, the Ukrainian president made clear his country's requirements.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukraine must get everything to win, modern and powerful weapons to gain an advantage over the Russian army, financial support, to have resources against Russia whose revenues are still very high in the hundred days that this was lasted Russia's already earned 93 billion euros just for the sale of energy keep said that so far has received only 10 percent of all the money it has been promised by its allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Canada and Denmark have settled a largely good-natured dispute over a tiny, barren, uninhabited outcrop in the Arctic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They've agreed to split it and effectively created the first land border between Canada and Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The row over the 1.3 square kilometer Hans Island, which sits between Ellesmere and Greenland, dates back to 1973, when the marine boundary was drawn between Canada and Greenland, part of the Danish kingdom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Danes and Canadians have visited the rock by helicopter over the past decades to lay claim to it, leading to diplomatic protests, online campaigns, even a Canadian call to boycott Danish pastries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: During those ministerial visits, each side would plant a flag and leave behind a bottle of whiskey or snaps for the other to enjoy, along with comical notes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: With the dispute becoming known as the Whiskey War, it was apt the two sides exchange bottles of the celebrated tipple.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. It's time for us to take a short break, but do stay with us. There's much more coming up after the break.
